review: Disappointed at first, applied for a return.  Played with  it a bit more and decided to keep.  Should I return and order it again, or can it be recharged to my my account and save the wear and tear on the postal service?  A week later, Great Potential, but I constantly am told that my system does not have enough band width to support continuous streaming.  How much band width is required?  I have the top end of Hughes Satellite internet, an Asus router with 130Mbps link speed showing on my Kindle Fire HD.  Still, when I try to stream a movie it only buffers a few seconds at a time.  Any Suggestions?  New post: In regard to the status of the subject order, please review the sequence of events:1) 5/31 Ordered Amazon Fire TV Stick.2)  6/01 Fire Stick price posted to my account.  Fire Stick received.3) 6/02  Requested return of Fire Stick.4) 6/03  Refund was posted to my account.4) 6/03  Decided to keep Fire Stick.  Via Customer Review, requested that return be nullified and if refund had already beenprocessed  reinstatement of charge was authorized.5) 6/04 Charge was reinstated on my account.At this point, I have received one Fire Stick, been charged for two, received refund for one.  We're even.7) 7/07  Received notice that return had not been received, and would be reinstated as a charge.  There was no provision forresponse to this notification.
